skillTree.localised_description: The finest horses in the Old World, bred for their endurance and fiery temperament, barded for further protection.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
This unit can pass through trees.

skillTree.localised_description: Having spent a long time guarding the reclaimed Grail Chapel of Challotte deep in Athel Loren, Agravain has had the time and opportunity to capture and tame a powerful and magical beast of the forest, the mighty Great Stag!

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
This unit can pass through trees.

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type

skillTree.localised_description: Agravain was raised in the Castle of Beaumarchais in Quenelles. While his father was away on campaign, he was placed in charge of the castle and he performed his duties admirably.

effects.description:
Construction cost: -25% for all buildings
	(local region)

Construction time: -50% for all buildings
	(local region)

skillTree.localised_description: Even as a mere Knight Errant, Agravain has already accomplished the nigh-impossible: the slaying of the great dragon Drogo le Mal, a persistent scourge on Beaumarchais and its inhabitants.
Agravain skillfully overpowered the lone guardian of the Tree of Shields, an Asrai Prince named Gyferth, who was a deadly combatant and in every way a worthy adversary.

effects.description: Leadership: +4 when fighting against Wood Elves
Melee attack: +4 when fighting against Wood Elves
Leadership: +8 when fighting against Wood Elves
Melee attack: +8 when fighting against Wood Elves
Leadership: +8 when fighting against Wood Elves

Enemy leadership: -5 when fighting against Wood Elves
	(enemy armies in local region)

Enemy melee defence: -5 when fighting against Wood Elves
	(enemy armies in local region)
Melee attack: +8 when fighting against Wood Elves

skillTree.localised_description: Having won the Battle of the Tree of Shields alongside the Grail Damsel Eleanor, daughter of the Duke of Quenelles, Agravain serves as her sole and devoted protector.

effects.description:
Enemy Hero action success chance: -6%
	(enemy characters in region)

target_if: Unit is a Lord or Hero

skillTree.localised_description: Having conquered the elves and recovered the lost chapel, Agravain remains with Eleanor to guard Challotte from reprisal as the Duke of Quenelles restores the once-sacred building.

effects.description:
Missile resistance: +8 when fighting against Wood Elves
	(Hero's army)

Enemy leadership: -4 when enemy lays siege or encircles
	(local region)

	(Hero's army)

Enemy leadership: -8 when enemy lays siege or encircles
	(local region)

Missile resistance: +24 when fighting against Wood Elves
	(Hero's army)

Enemy leadership: -16 when enemy lays siege or encircles
	(local region)

skillTree.localised_description: This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
Full-plate armour protects the wearer from head-to-foot. Many such suits are blessed or imbued with arcane abilities.
Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, itâ€™s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
A deadly blade is especially lethal when in the hands of this master death-maker, killer and slaughterer!
From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.
A blade that sings in defence will not let its wielder be penetrated.
The war is endless. The cycle of charging, clashing, and bloody hand-to-hand fighting is without end. It will never stop.
This champion extols discipline and fear away from the battlefield as much as on it.

effects.description: Training action: Unit experience gain is increased by an additional 10%
Training action: Unit experience gain is increased by an additional 20%
Training action: Unit experience gain is increased by an additional 30%

skillTree.localised_description: The sight of this warrior, their stature, import or infamy, can have a calming effect.

effects.description: Spread Control action: Control is modified by an additional 1
Spread Control action: Control is modified by an additional 2
Spread Control action: Control is modified by an additional 3

skillTree.localised_description: "If they know I'm coming then more's the better!"

effects.description: Assault Garrison action: Additional 5% casualties inflicted
Assault Garrison action: Additional 15% casualties inflicted
Assault Garrison action: Additional 30% casualties inflicted

skillTree.localised_description: A skilled assassin is a cold-hearted killer and merciless murderer.
Lying in wait, experienced and patient, striking when the foe least expects.

effects.description: Assault Units action: Additional 3% casualties inflicted
Assault Units action: Additional 8% casualties inflicted
Assault Units action: Additional 15% casualties inflicted

skillTree.localised_description: An expert in their craft, this Hero knows all the mistakes that can be made and how to best avoid making them.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
Allows the unit to attack and destroy walls in melee. This attribute also adds a  +50% damage multiplier against buildings.

items.colour_text: The fair Lady Melisande gifted a curl of her hair to Agravain after his deadly performance at the Grand Tourney. A mystical favour, this token of affection has the power to protect the hero from bodily harm.

effects.description: Passive ability: "The Blessing of the Lady"

items.colour_text: The magnificent Chalice of Chanterelle, unsurpassed in its craftsmanship, is believed by many to be Holy Grail itself. Even if it isn't, it is still holds of great mystical power.

effects.description: Passive ability: "The Blessing of the Lady"

items.colour_text: Jasper the jester and the bard Blondel begged Agravain to let them accompany him. Jasper takes care of the paladin's mighty warhorse, while Blondel is composing a chanson to tell the story of Agravain's heroic deeds.

effects.description:
Enemy Hero action success chance: -8%
	(enemy characters in region)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: This brave and pious hero is guided and inspired through visions from the beautiful, magical Lady of the Lake.

effects.description: When normally killed in action, this Hero will be wounded instead

Construction time: -1 for Province Capital/Settlement buildings
	(local region)
